summary.label: Table 2-1:
summary.name: Summary
summary.desc: lists the SMPP PDU set and the context in which each PDU may be used:

pdu.label: Table 4-1:
pdu.name: bind_transmitter
pdu.desc: The format of the SMPP bind_transmitter PDU is defined in the following table.
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the bind_transmitter PDU.
Value corresponding to bind_transmitter request.
Not used in bind_transmitter PDU. Must be set to NULL.
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated bind_transmitter_resp PDU will echo the same sequence number.
Identifies the ESME system requesting to bind as a transmitter with the SMSC.
The password may be used by the SMSC to authenticate the ESME requesting to bind.
Identifies the type of ESME system requesting to bind as a transmitter with the SMSC.
Indicates the version of the SMPP protocol supported by the ESME.
Indicates Type of Number of the ESME address. If not known set to NULL
Numbering Plan Indicator for ESME address. If not known set to NULL.
The ESME address. If not known set to NULL.

pdu.label: Table 4-2:
pdu.name: bind_transmitter_resp
pdu.desc: The SMPP bind_transmitter_resp PDU is used to reply to a bind_transmitter request
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the bind_transmitter_resp PDU.
Value corresponding to bind_transmitter_resp .
Indicates status (success or error code) of original bind_transmitter request.
Set to sequence number of original bind_transmitter request.
SMSC identifier. Identifies the SMSC to the ESME.
SMPP version supported by SMSC

pdu.label: Table 4-3:
pdu.name: bind_receiver
pdu.desc: The format of the SMPP bind_receiver PDU is defined in the following table .
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the PDU in octets.
Value corresponding to bind_receiver request.
Not used in bind_receiver PDU. Set to NULL.
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated bind_receiver_resp PDU will echo the same sequence number.
Identifies the ESME system requesting to bind as a receiver with the SMSC.
The password may be used by the SMSC for security reasons to authenticate the ESME requesting to bind.
Identifies the type of ESME system requesting to bind as a receiver with the SMSC.
Identifies the version of the SMPP protocol supported by the ESME.
Type of Number (TON) for ESME address(es) served via this SMPP receiver session. Set to NULL if not known.
Numbering Plan Indicator (NPI) for ESME address(es) served via this SMPP receiver session. Set to NULL if not known.

A single ESME address or a range of ESME addresses served via this SMPP receiver session. The parameter value is represented in UNIX regular expression format (see Appendix A). Set to NULL if not known.

pdu.label: Table 4-4:
pdu.name: bind_receiver_resp
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the PDU.
Value corresponding to bind_receiver_resp.
Indicates status (success or error code) of original bind_receiver request.
Set to sequence number of original bind_receiver request.
SMSC identifier. Identifies the SMSC to the ESME.

pdu.label: Table 4-5:
pdu.name: bind_transceiver
pdu.desc: The format of the SMPP bind_transceiver PDU is defined in the following table .
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the PDU.
Value corresponding to bind_transceiver request.
Not used in bind_transceiver PDU. Set to NULL .
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated bind_transceiver_resp PDU will echo the same sequence number.
Identifies the ESME system requesting to bind as a transceiver with the SMSC.
The password may be used by the SMSC to authenticate the ESME requesting to bind.
Identifies the type of ESME system requesting to bind as a transceiver with the SMSC.
Identifies the version of the SMPP protocol supported by the ESME.
Type of Number (TON) for ESME address(es) served via this SMPP transceiver session. Set to NULL (Unknown) if not known.
Numbering Plan Indicator (NPI) for ESME address(es) served via this SMPP transceiver session. Set to NULL (Unknown) if not known.

A single ESME address or a range of ESME addresses served via this SMPP transceiver session. This field may be used by the SMSC for authentication, verification or routing purposes. Set to NULL if not known.

pdu.label: Table 4-6:
pdu.name: bind_transceiver_resp
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the PDU.
Value corresponding to bind_transceiver_resp.
Indicates status (success or error code) of original bind_transceiver request.
Set to sequence number of original bind_transceiver request.
SMSC identifier. Identifies the SMSC to the ESME.

pdu.label: Table 4.1.7.1:
pdu.name: outbind
pdu.desc: The format of the SMPP outbind PDU is defined in the following table .
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the PDU.
Value corresponding to bind_transceiver request.
Not used in bind_transceiver PDU. Set to NULL .
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated bind_transceiver_resp PDU will echo the same sequence number.
Identifies the ESME system requesting to bind as a transceiver with the SMSC.
The password may be used by the SMSC to authenticate the ESME requesting to bind.

pdu.label: Table 4-7:
pdu.name: unbind
pdu.desc: The format of the SMPP unbind PDU is defined in the following table . The command_id field must include the Command ID value corresponding to the unbind operation.
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the PDU.
Value corresponding to unbind request.
Not used. Set to NULL.
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated unbind_resp PDU will echo the same sequence number.

pdu.label: Table 4-8:
pdu.name: unbind_resp
pdu.desc: The format of the SMPP unbind_resp PDU is defined in the following table. The command_id field must include the Command ID value corresponding to the unbind_resp operation.
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the PDU.
Value corresponding to unbind_resp PDU.
Indicates outcome of original unbind request.
Set to sequence number of original unbind request.

pdu.label: Table 4-9:
pdu.name: generic_nack
pdu.desc: Following is the format of the SMPP generic_nack PDU . It comprises the SMPP message header only .
pdu.field: Defines the overall length of the PDU.
Value corresponding to generic_nack PDU.
Error code corresponding to reason for sending the generic_nack.
Set to sequence number of original PDU or to NULL if the original PDU cannot be decoded.

pdu.label: Table 4-10:
pdu.name: submit_sm
pdu.desc: The format of the SMPP submit_sm PDU is defined in the following table .
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
submit_sm
Not used. Set to NULL.
Set to a Unique sequence number. The associated submit_sm_resp PDU will echo this sequence number.

The service_type parameter can be used to indicate the SMS Application service associated with the message. Specifying the service_type allows the ESME to avail of enhanced messaging services such as “replace by service” type to control the teleservice used on the air interface. Set to NULL for default SMSC settings.
Type of Number for source address. If not known, set to NULL (Unknown).
Numbering Plan Indicator for source address. If not known, set to NULL (Unknown).
Address of SME which originated this message. If not known, set to NULL (Unknown).
Type of Number for destination.
Numbering Plan Indicator for destination.
Destination address of this short message. For mobile terminated messages, this is the directory number of the recipient MS.
Indicates Message Mode & Message Type.
Protocol Identifier. Network specific field.
Designates the priority level of the message.
The short message is to be scheduled by the SMSC for delivery. Set to NULL for immediate message delivery.
The validity period of this message. Set to NULL to request the SMSC default validity period.
Indicator to signify if an SMSC delivery receipt or an SME acknowledgement is required.
Flag indicating if submitted message should replace an existing message.
Defines the encoding scheme of the short message user data.
Indicates the short message to send from a list of predefined (‘canned’) short messages stored on the SMSC. If not using an SMSC canned message, set to NULL.
Length in octets of the short_message user data.

Up to 254 octets of short message user data. The exact physical limit for short_message size may vary according to the underlying network. Applications which need to send messages longer than 254 octets should use the message_payload parameter. In this case the sm_length field should be set to zero. Note: The short message data should be inserted in either the short_message or message_payload fields. Both fields must not be used simultaneously.
ESME assigned message reference number.
Indicates the application port number associated with the source address of the message. This parameter should be present for WAP applications.
The subcomponent in the destination device which created the user data.
Indicates the application port number associated with the destination address of the message. This parameter should be present for WAP applications.
The subcomponent in the destination device for which the user data is intended.
The reference number for a particular concatenated short message.
Indicates the total number of short messages within the concatenated short message.
Indicates the sequence number of a particular short message fragment within the concatenated short message.
Indicates that there are more messages to follow for the destination SME.
defines the type of payload (e.g. WDP, WCMP, etc.).

Contains the extended short message user data. Up to 64K octets can be transmitted. Note: The short message data should be inserted in either the short_message or message_payload fields. Both fields should not be used simultaneously. The sm_length field should be set to zero if using the message_payload parameter .
Indicates the level of privacy associated with the message.
A callback number associated with the short message. This parameter can be included a number of times for multiple callback addresses.

Defines the callback number presentation and screening. If this parameter is present and there are multiple instances of the callback_num parameter then this parameter must occur an equal number of instances and the order of occurrence determines the part icular callback_num_pres_ind which corresponds to a particular callback_num .

Associates a displayable alphanumeric tag with the callback number. If this parameter is present and there are multiple instances of the callback_num parameter then this parameter must occur an equal number of instances and the order of occurrence determin es the particular callback_num_atag which corresponds to a particular callback_num .
The subaddress of the message originator.
The subaddress of the message destination.
A user response code. The actual response codes are implementation specific.
Provides the receiving MS with a display time associated with the message.
Indicates the alerting mechanism when the message is received by an MS.
Indicates validity information for this message to the recipient MS.
This parameter controls the indication and specifies the message type (of the message associated with the MWI) at the mobile station.
Indicates the number of messages stored in a mail box
Request an MS alert signal be invoked on message delivery.
Indicates the language of an alphanumeric text message.
The MS user’s reply method to an SMS delivery message received from the network is indicated and controlled by this parameter.
Session control information for Interactive Teleservice.
This parameter is used to identify the required USSD Service type when interfacing to a USSD system.

pdu.label: Table 4-11:
pdu.name: submit_sm_resp
pdu.desc: This is the response to the submit_sm PDU and has the following format:
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
submit_sm_resp
Indicates outcome of submit_sm request.
Set to sequence number of original submit_sm PDU.
This field contains the SMSC message ID of the submitted message. It may be used at a later stage to query the status of a message, cancel or replace the message.

pdu.label: Table 4-12:
pdu.name: submit_multi
pdu.desc: Following is the format of the SMPP submit_multi PDU. The command_id field contains the command identifier code for submit_multi .
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
submit_multi
Not used. Set to NULL.
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated submit_multi_resp PDU will echo the same sequence number.

The service_type parameter can be used to indicate the SMS Application service associated with the message. Specifying the service_type allows the ESME to avail of enhanced messaging services such as replace by service type to control the teleservice used on the air interface. Set to NULL for default SMSC settings.
Type of Number for source address. If not known, set to NULL (Unknown).
Numbering Plan Indicator for source. If not known, set to NULL (Unknown).
Address of SME which originated this message. If not known, set to NULL (Unknown).

Number of destination addresses - indicates the number of dest_address structures that are to follow. A maximum of 254 destination addresses are allowed. Note: Set to 1 when submitting to one SME Address OR when submitting to one Distribution List.
Contains one or more ( number_of_dests ) SME addresses or/and Distribution List names.
Indicates Message Mode & Message Type.
Protocol Identifier. Network specific field.
Designates the priority level of the message.
The short message is to be scheduled by the SMSC for delivery. Set to NULL for immediate message delivery.
The validity period of this message. Set to NULL to request the SMSC default validity period.
Indicator to signify if an SMSC delivery receipt or an SME acknowledgement is required.
Reserved. Must be set to NULL.
Indicates the encoding scheme of the short message.
Indicates the short message to send from a list of predefined (“canned”) short messages stored on the SMSC. If not using an SMSC predefined message, set to NULL.
Length in octets of the short_message user data.

Up to 254 octets of short message user data. The exact physical limit for short_message size may vary according to the underlying network. Applications which need to send messages longer than 254 octets should use the message_payload parameter. In this case the sm_length parameter should be set to zero. Note: The short message data should be inserted in either the short_message or message_pay load parameters. Both parameters must not be used simultaneously.
ESME assigned message reference number.
Indicates the application port number associated with the source address of the message. This parameter should be present for WAP applications.
The subcomponent in the destination device which created the user data.
Indicates the application port number associated with the destination address of the message. This parameter should be present for WAP applications
The subcomponent in the destination device for which the user data is intended.
The reference number for a particular concatenated short message.
Indicates the total number of short messages within the concatenated short message.
Indicates the sequence number of a particular short message fragment within the concatenated short message.
Defines the type of payload (e.g. WDP, WCMP, etc.)

Contains the extended short message user data. Up to 64K octets can be transmitted. Note: The short message data should be inserted in either the short_message or message_payload fields. Both fields should not be used simultaneously. The sm_length field sh ould be set to zero if using the message_payload parameter .
Indicates the level of privacy associated with the message.
A callback number associated with the short message. This parameter can be included a number of times for multiple callback addresses.

Identifies the presentation and screening associated with the callback number. If this parameter is present and there are multiple instances of the callback_num parameter then this parameter must occur an equal number of instances and the order of occurren ce determines the particular callback_num_pres_ind which corresponds to a particular callback_num .

Associates a displayable alphanumeric tag with the callback number. If this parameter is present and there are multiple instances of the callback_num parameter then this parameter must occur an equal number of instances and the order of occurrence determines the particular callback_num_atag which corresponds to a particular callback_num .
The subaddress of the message originator.
The subaddress of the message destination.
Provides the receiving MS based SME with a display time associated with the message.
Indicates the alerting mechanism when the message is received by an MS.
Indicates validity information for this message to the recipient MS.
This parameter controls the indication and specifies the message type (of the message associated with the MWI) at the mobile station.
Requests an MS alert signal be invoked on message delivery.
Indicates the language of an alphanumeric text message.

tlv.label: Table 4-13:
tlv.name: dest_address
tlv.field: Flag which will identify whether destination address is a Distribution List name or SME address.

field.name: SME Address or Distribution List Name

tlv.field: Depending on dest_flag this could be an SME Address or a Distribution List Name.
Type of Number for destination SME.
Numbering Plan Indicator for destination SME.
Destination Address for this short message.

pdu.label: Table 4-16:
pdu.name: submit_multi_resp
pdu.desc: The following is the format of the SMPP submit_multi_resp PDU. The command_id field contains the command identifier code for submit_multi_resp.
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
submit_multi_resp
Outcome of submit_multi request.
Set to sequence number of original submit_multi PDU.
The SMSC message ID of the submitted message.
The number of messages to destination SME addresses that were unsuccessfully submitted to the SMSC.
Contains one or more ( no_unsuccess ) SME address(es) or/and Distribution List names to which submission was unsuccessful.

tlv.label: Table 4-17:
tlv.name: Unsuccess_smes
tlv.field: Type of number for destination SME.
Numbering Plan Indicator for destination SME
Indicates the success or failure of the submit_multi request to this SME address.

pdu.label: Table 4-18:
pdu.name: deliver_sm
pdu.desc: The deliver_sm PDU has the same format as the submit_sm PDU. For this reason, some fields are unused.
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
deliver_sm
Unused. Set to NULL.
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated deliver_sm_resp PDU should echo the same sequence number.
The service_type parameter can be used to indicate the SMS Application service associated with the message.
Type of Number for source address. If not known, set to NULL (Unknown).
Numbering Plan Indicator for source. If not known, set to NULL (Unknown).
Address of SME which originated this message. If not known, set to NULL (Unknown).
Type of number of destination SME.
Numbering Plan Indicator of destination SME.
Destination address of destination SME.
Indicates Message Type and enhanced network services.
Protocol Identifier. Network Specific Field.
Designates the priority level of the message.
This field is unused for deliver_sm. It must be set to NULL.
This field is unused for deliver_sm It must be set to NULL.
Indicates if an ESME acknowledgement is required.
Not used in deliver_sm . It must be set to NULL.
Indicates the encoding scheme of the short message.
Unused in deliver_sm . It must be set to NULL.
Length of short message user data in octets.

Up to 254 octets of short message user data. When sending messages longer than 254 octets the message_payload parameter should be used and the sm_length parameter should be set to zero. Note: The message data should be inserted in either the short_message or the message_payload parameters. Both parameters must not be used simultaneously.

A reference assigned by the originating SME to the message. In the case that the deliver_sm is carrying an SMSC delivery receipt, an SME delivery acknowledgement or an SME user acknowledgement (as indicated in the esm_class field), the user_message_reference parameter is set to the message reference of the original message.
Indicates the application port number associated with the source address of the message. The parameter should be present for WAP applications.
Indicates the application port number associated with the destination address of the message. The parameter should be present for WAP applications.
The reference number for a particular concatenated short message.
Indicates the total number of short messages within the concatenated short message.
Indicates the sequence number of a particular short message fragment within the concatenated short message.
A user response code. The actual response codes are SMS application specific.
Indicates a level of privacy associated with the message.
Defines the type of payload (e.g. WDP, WCMP, etc.)

Contains the extended short message user data. Up to 64K octets can be transmitted. Note: The short message data should be inserted in either the short_message or message_payload fields. Both fields should not be used simultaneously. The sm_length field should be set to zero if using the message_payload parameter.
A callback number associated with the short message. This parameter can be included a number of times for multiple call back addresses.
The subaddress of the message originator.
The subaddress of the message destination.
Indicates the language of an alphanumeric text message.
Session control information for Interactive Teleservice.
Network Error Code. May be present for Intermediate Notifications and SMSC Delivery Receipts
Message State. Should be present for SMSC Delivery Receipts and Intermediate Notifications.
SMSC message ID of receipted message Should be present for SMSC Delivery Receipts and Intermediate Notifications.

pdu.label: Table 4-19:
pdu.name: deliver_sm_resp
pdu.desc: The following is the format of the SMPP deliver_sm_resp PDU.
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
deliver_sm_resp
Indicates outcome of deliver_sm request.
Set to sequence number of deliver_sm PDU.
This field is unused and is set to NULL.

pdu.label: Table 4-20:
pdu.name: data_sm
pdu.desc: The following is the format of the SMPP data_sm PDU.
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
data_sm
Not used. Set to NULL.
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated data_sm_resp PDU will echo the same sequence number. This parameter is used to facilitate transaction windowing.

The service_type parameter can be used to indicate the SMS Application service associated with the message. Specifying the service_type allows the ESME/SMSC to • to indicate the teleservice used on the air interface.
Type of Number for source address. If not known, set to “Unknown” (0x00).
Numbering Plan Indicator for source address. If not known, set to “Unknown” (0x00).
Address of SME which originated this message.
Type of Number for destination.
Numbering Plan Indicator for destination.
Destination address of this short message. For mobile terminated messages, this is the directory number of the recipient MS.
Indicates Message Mode and Message Type.
Indicator for requesting a SMSC delivery receipt or an SME acknowledgement
Indicates the encoding scheme of the payload data
Indicates the application port number associated with the source address of the message. This parameter should be present for WAP applications.
The subcomponent in the destination device which created the user data.
The correct network associated with the originating device.
The correct bearer type for the delivering the user data to the destination.
The telematics identifier associated with the source.
Indicates the application port number associated with the destination address of the message. This parameter should be present for WAP applications.
The subcomponent in the destination device for which the user data is intended.
The correct network for the destination device.
The correct bearer type for the delivering the user data to the destination.
The telematics identifier associated with the destination.
The reference number for a particular concatenated short message.
Indicates the total number of short messages within the concatenated short message.
Indicates the sequence number of a particular short message fragment within the concatenated short message.
Indicates that there are more messages to follow for the destination SME.
Time to live as a relative time in seconds from submission.
Defines the type of payload (e.g. WDP, WCMP, etc.).
Contains the message user data. Up to 64K octets can be transmitted.
Indicator for setting Delivery Pending Flag on delivery failure.
SMSC message ID of message being receipted. Should be present for SMSC Delivery Receipts and Intermediate Notifications.
Message State. Should be present for SMSC Delivery Receipts and Intermediate Notifications.
Network error code. May be present for SMSC Delivery Receipts and Intermediate Notifications.
ESME assigned message reference number.
Indicates a level of privacy associated with the message.
A callback number associated with the short message. This parameter can be included a number of times for multiple call back addresses.

This parameter identifies the presentation and screening associated with the callback number. If this parameter is present and there are multiple instances of the callback_num parameter then this parameter must occur an equal number of instances and the or der of occurrence determines the particular callback_num_pres_ind which corresponds to a particular callback_num .

This parameter associates a displayable alphanumeric tag with the callback number. If this parameter is present and there are multiple instances of the callback_num parameter then this parameter must occur an equal number of instances and the order of occu rrence determines the particular callback_num_atag which corresponds to a particular callback_num .
The subaddress of the message originator.
The subaddress of the message destination.
A user response code. The actual response codes are implementation specific.
Provides the receiving MS based SME with a display time associated with the message.
Indicates the alerting mechanism when the message is received by an MS.
Indicates validity information for this message to the recipient MS.
This parameter controls the indication and specifies the message type (of the message associated with the MWI) at the mobile station.
Indicates the number of messages stored in a mail box (e.g. voice mail box).
Requests an MS alert signal be invoked on message delivery.
Indicates the language of an alphanumeric text message.
The MS user’s reply method to an SMS delivery message received from the network is indicated and controlled by this parameter.
Session control information for Interactive Teleservice.

pdu.label: Table 4-21:
pdu.name: data_sm_resp
pdu.desc: The following is the format of the SMPP data_sm_resp PDU.
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU
data_sm_resp
Indicates outcome of data_sm request.
Set to sequence number of original data_sm PDU.
This field contains the SMSC assigned message ID of the short message.
Include to indicate reason for delivery failure.
Error code specific to a wireless network.
pdu.optional: ASCII text giving a description of the meaning of the response
pdu.field: Indicates whether the Delivery Pending Flag was set.

pdu.label: Table 4-22:
pdu.name: query_sm
pdu.desc: Following is the format of the SMPP query_sm PDU.
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU
query_sm
Not used. Set to NULL.
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated query_sm_resp PDU should echo the same sequence number

Message ID of the message whose state is to be queried. This must be the SMSC assigned Message ID allocated to the original short message when submitted to the SMSC by the submit_sm, data_sm or submit_multi command, and returned in the response PDU by the SMSC.
Type of Number of message originator. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the original request PDU (e.g. submit_sm ). If not known, set to NULL.
Numbering Plan Identity of message originator. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the original request PDU (e.g. submit_sm ). If not known, set to NULL.
Address of message originator. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the original request PDU (e.g. submit_sm ). If not known, set to NULL.

pdu.label: Table 4-23:
pdu.name: query_sm_resp
pdu.desc: Following is the format of the SMPP query_sm_resp PDU.
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
query_sm_resp
Indicates outcome of query_sm request
Set to sequence number of original query_sm PDU.
SMSC Message ID of the message whose state is being queried.
Date and time when the queried message reached a final state. For messages which have not yet reached a final state this field will contain a single NULL octet.
Specifies the status of the queried short message.
Where appropriate this holds a network error code defining the reason for failure of message delivery.

pdu.label: Table 4-24:
pdu.name: cancel_sm
pdu.desc: Following is the format of the SMPP cancel_sm PDU.
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
cancel_sm
Not used. Set to NULL.
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated cancel_sm_resp PDU should echo the same sequence number.
Set to indicate SMS Application service, if cancellation of a group of application service messages is desired. Otherwise set to NULL.
Message ID of the message to be cancelled. This must be the SMSC assigned Message ID of the original message. Set to NULL if cancelling a group of messages.
Type of Number of message originator. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the original message submission request PDU. If not known, set to NULL.
Numbering Plan Identity of message originator. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the original message submission request PDU. If not known, set to NULL.
Source address of message(s) to be cancelled. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the original message submission request PDU(s).

Type of number of destination SME address of the message(s) to be cancelled. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the original message submission request PDU (e.g. submit_sm ). May be set to NULL when the message_id is provided.

Numbering Plan Indicator of destination SME address of the message(s)) to be cancelled. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the original message submission request PDU. May be set to NULL when the message_id is provided.

Destination address of message(s) to be cancelled. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the original message submission request PDU. May be set to NULL when the message_id is provided.

pdu.label: Table 4-25:
pdu.name: cancel_sm_resp
pdu.desc: The cancel_sm_resp PDU is used to reply to a cancel_sm request. It comprises the SMPP message header only .
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
cancel_sm_resp
Indicates outcome of cancel_sm request.
Set to sequence number of cancel_sm PDU.

pdu.label: Table 4-26:
pdu.name: replace_sm
pdu.desc: Following is the format of the SMPP replace_sm PDU. The command_id field contains the command identifier code for replace_sm .
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
replace_sm
Not used. Set to NULL
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated replace_sm_resp PDU should echo the same sequence number.

SMSC message ID of the message to be replaced. This must be the message ID allocated to the original short message when submitted to the SMSC by the submit_sm command, and returned in the submit_sm_resp message by the SMSC.
Type of Number of mesage originator. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the corresponding submit_sm request. If not known, set to NULL.
Numbering Plan Identity of message originator. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the corresponding submit_sm request. If not known set to NULL.
Originating address of the short message to be replaced. This is used for verification purposes, and must match that supplied in the corresponding submit_sm request.
New scheduled delivery time for the short message. Set to NULL, if updating of the original scheduled delivery time is not desired.
New expiration time for the short message. Set to NULL, if updating of the original expiration time is not required.
New registered delivery parameter setting.
New pre-defined (canned) message identifier.
Length of new short message in octets.
New short message to replace existing message.

pdu.label: Table 4-27:
pdu.name: replace_sm_resp
pdu.desc: The replace_sm_resp PDU is used to reply to a replace_sm request. It comprises the SMPP message header only .
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
replace_sm_resp
Indicates outcome of replace_sm request
Expected to be the same sequence number of original replace_sm PDU.

pdu.label: Table 4-28:
pdu.name: enquire_link
pdu.desc: The enquire_link PDU comprises the SMPP message header only.
pdu.field: Description
Set to overall length of PDU
enquire_link
Not used. Set to NULL
Set to a unique sequence number. The associated enquire_link_resp PDU should echo the same sequence number

pdu.label: Table 4-29:
pdu.name: enquire_link_resp
pdu.desc: The enquire_link_resp PDU is used to reply to an enquire_link request. It comprises the SMPP message header only .
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU
enquire_link_resp
Set to ESME_ROK (Success)
Set to the same sequence number of original enquire_link PDU

pdu.label: Table 4-30:
pdu.name: alert_notification
pdu.desc: Following is the format of the SMPP alert_notification PDU.
pdu.field: Set to overall length of PDU.
alert_notification
Not used. Set to NULL.
Set to a unique sequence number.
Type of number for the MS which has become available. If not known, set to NULL.
Numbering Plan Indicator for the MS which has become available. If not known, set to NULL.
Address of MS which has become available.
Type of number for destination address which requested an alert on a particular MS becoming available. If not known, set to NULL.
Numbering Plan Indicator for ESME which requested an alert on a particular MS becoming available. If not known, set to NULL.
Address of ESME which requested an alert on a particular MS becoming available.
The status of the mobile station.

enum.label: Table 5-1:
enum.name: CommandIDs
enum.desc: The complete set of SMPP Command IDs and their associated values are defined in the following table.

enum.label: Table 5-2:
enum.name: ErrorCodes
enum.desc: The complete set of SMPP Error Codes and their associated values are defined in the following table.
enum.field: Incorrect BIND Status for given command

enum.label: Table 5-2:
enum.name: ErrorCodes
enum.field: Invalid ‘submit with replace’ request (i.e. submit_sm with replace_if_present_flag set)
Throttling error (ESME has exceeded allowed message limits)

enum.label: Table 5-2:
enum.name: ErrorCodes
enum.field: Predefined Message Invalid or Not Found
ESME Receiver Temporary App Error Code
ESME Receiver Permanent App Error Code
ESME Receiver Reject Message Error Code
Error in the optional part of the PDU Body.

field.name: Reserved for SMSC vendor specific errors

enum.field: Reserved for SMSC vendor specific errors

field.name: Indicates that the EMSE supports version 3.3 or earlier of the SMPP protocol.
Indicates that the ESME is supporting SMPP version 3.4

enum.label: Table 5-3:
enum.name: TON
enum.desc: These fields define the Type of Number (TON) to be used in the SME address parameters. The following TON values are defined:

enum.label: Table 5-4:
enum.name: NPI
enum.desc: These fields define the Numeric Plan Indicator (NPI) to be used in the SME address parameters. The following NPI values are defined:

field.name: WAP Client Id (to be defined by WAP Forum)
0 0 x x x x x x
0 1 x x x x x x
1 0 x x x x x x
1 1 x x x x x x

enum.label: Table 5-5:
enum.name: SMPP
enum.desc: These are applied in different networks as follows:-

field.value: x x x x x x 0 0
x x x x x x 0 1
x x x x x x 1 0
x x x x x x 1 1
x x x x 0 0 x x
x x x x 0 1 x x
x x x x 1 0 x x
x x x x 1 1 x x
x x x 0 x x x x
x x x 1 x x x x

tlv.label: Table 5-6:
tlv.name: Message
tlv.desc: The following is a list of allowable sta tes for a short message. The message_state value is returned by the SMSC to the ESME as part of the query_sm_resp PDU.
The following is a list of allowable sta tes for a short message. The message_state value is returned by the SMSC to the ESME as part of the query_sm_resp PDU.

enum.label: Table 5-7:
enum.name: Optional
enum.desc: Generic optional parameters may be applicable to all wireless network techno logies i.e., GSM/ iDEN, TDMA and CDMA.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.1
tlvref.name: dest_addr_subunit
tlvref.field: dest_addr_subunit
Length of Value part in octets
0x00 = Unknown (default) 0x01 = MS Display 0x02 = Mobile Equipment 0x03 = Smart Card 1 (expected to be SIM if a SIM exists in the MS) 0x04 = External Unit 1 5 to 255 = reserved

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.2
tlvref.name: source_addr_subunit
tlvref.field: source_addr_subunit
Length of Value part in octets

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.3
tlvref.name: dest_network_type
tlvref.field: dest_network_type
Length of Value part in octets
0x00 = Unknown 0x01 = GSM 0x02 = ANSI-136/TDMA 0x03 = IS-95/CDMA 0x04 = PDC 0x05 = PHS 0x06 = iDEN 0x07 = AMPS 0x08 = Paging Network 9 to 255 = reserved

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.4
tlvref.name: source_network_type
tlvref.field: source_network_type
Length of Value part in octets

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.5
tlvref.name: dest_bearer_type
tlvref.field: dest_bearer_type
Length of Value part in octets
0x00 = Unknown 0x01 = SMS 0x02 = Circuit Switched Data (CSD) 0x03 = Packet Data 0x04 = USSD 0x05 = CDPD 0x06 = DataTAC 0x07 = FLEX/ReFLEX 0x08 = Cell Broadcast (cellcast) 9 to 255 = reserved

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.6
tlvref.name: source_bearer_type
tlvref.field: source_bearer_type
Length of Value part in octets

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.7
tlvref.name: parameter
tlvref.field: dest_telematics_id
Length of Value part in octets
to be defined

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.8
tlvref.name: source_telematics_id
tlvref.field: source_telematics_id
Length of Value part in octets

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.9
tlvref.name: parameter
tlvref.field: qos_time_to_live
Length of Value part in octets
number of seconds for message to be retained by the receiving system.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.10
tlvref.name: payload_type
tlvref.field: payload_type
Length of Value part in octets

Default. In the case of a WAP application, the default higher layer message type is a WDP message. See [WDP] for details. WCMP message. Wireless Control Message Protocol formatted data. See [WCMP] for details. values 2 to 255 are reserved

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.11
tlvref.name: additional_status_info_text
tlvref.field: additional_status_info_text
Length of Value part in octets
Free format text to allow implementations to supply the most useful information for problem diagnosis. Maximum length is 256 octets.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.13
tlvref.name: ms_msg_wait_facilities
tlvref.field: ms_msg_wait_facilities
Length of Value part in octets

Bits 7............0 I00000TT This parameter controls the indication and specifies the message type (of the message associated with the MWI) at the mobile station. The Indicator is encoded in bit 7 as follows: = Set Indication Inactive = Set Indication Active The Type of Message associ ated with the MWI is encoded in bits 0 and 1 as follows: = Voicemail Message Waiting = Fax Message Waiting = Electronic Mail Message Waiting = Other Message Waiting

enum.label: Table 5-8:
enum.name: Privacy
enum.desc: The privacy_indicator indicates the privacy level of the message.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.15
tlvref.name: source_subaddress
tlvref.field: Length of Value part in octets

The first octet of the data field is a Type of Subaddress tag and indicates the type of subaddressing information included, and implies the type and length of subaddressing information which can accompany this tag value in the data field. Valid Tag values are: 00000001 - Reserved 00000010 - Reserved 10000000 - NSAP ( Even) [ITUT X.213] 10001000 - NSAP (Odd) [ITUT X.213] 10100000 - User Specified All other values Reserved The remaining octets contain the subaddress. A NSAP address shall be encoded using the preferred binary encoding specified in [ITUT X.213]. In this case the subaddress field contains the Authority and Format Identifier. A User Specified subaddress is encoded according to user specification, subject to a maximum of 22 octets.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.18
tlvref.name: response
tlvref.field: user_response_code
Length of value part in octets
0 to 255 (IS-95 CDMA) 0 to 15 (CMT-136 TDMA)

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.19
tlvref.name: language_indicator
tlvref.field: language_indicator
Length of value part in octets
= unspecified (default) = english = french = spanish4 = german 5 = Portuguese refer to [CMT-136] for other values

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.20
tlvref.name: source_port
tlvref.field: source_port
Length of value part in octets
All values allowed.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.21
tlvref.name: destination_port
tlvref.field: destination_port
Length of value part in octets
All values allowed.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.22
tlvref.name: sar_msg_ref_num
tlvref.field: sar_msg_ref_num
Length of value part in octets

This parameter shall contain a originator generated reference number so that a segmented short message may be reassembled into a single original message. This allows the parallel transmission of several segmented messages. This reference number shall remai n constant for every segment which makes up a particular concatenated short message. When present, the PDU must also contain the sar_total_segments and sar_segment_seqnum parameters. Otherwise this parameter shall be ignored.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.23
tlvref.name: sar_total_segments
tlvref.field: sar_total_segments
Length of value part in octets

This parameter shall contain a value in the range 1 to 255 indicating the total number of fragments within the concatenated short message. The value shall start at 1 and remain constant for every short messag e which makes up the concatenated short message. When present, the PDU must also contain the sar_msg_ref_num and sar_segment_seqnum parameters. Otherwise this parameter shall be ignored.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.25
tlvref.name: sc_interface_version
tlvref.field: sc_interface_version
Length of value part in octets
values as per 5.2.4. (interface_version)

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.26
tlvref.name: display_time
tlvref.field: display_time
Length of value part in octets
= Temporary = Default (default) = Invoke values 3 to 255 are reserved

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.27
tlvref.name: ms_validity
tlvref.field: ms_validity
Length of value part in octets
= Store Indefinitely (default) = Power Down = SID based registration area = Display Only values 4 to 255 are reserved

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.31
tlvref.name: network_error_code
tlvref.field: network_error_code
Length of value part in octets

Sub-field Size Type Network Type 1 Integer Error Code 2 Integer . The first octet indicates the network type. The following values are defined: = ANSI-136 = IS-95 = GSM = Reserved All other values reserved. The remaining two octets specify the actual network error code appropriate to the network type.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.32
tlvref.name: message_payload
tlvref.field: message_payload
Set to length of user data
Short message user data. The maximum size is SMSC and network implementation specific.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.34
tlvref.field: more_messages_to_send
Length of value part in octets
0 = No more messages to follow 1 = More messages to follow (default) values 2 to 255 are reserved

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.36
tlvref.name: callback_num
tlvref.field: Length of Value part in octets

Bits 7.............0 0000000D (octet 1) 00000TTT (octet 2) 0000NNNN (octet 3) XXXXXXXX (octet 4) : : XXXXXXXX (octet N) The originating SME can set a Call Back Number for the receiving Mobile Station. The first octet contains the Digit Mode Indicator. Bit D=0 indicates that the Call Back Number is sent to the mobile as DTMF digits encoded in TBCD. Bit D=1 indicates that the Call Back Number is sent to the mobile encoded as ASCII digits. The 2nd octet contains the Type of Number (TON). Encoded as in section 5.2.5. The third octet contains the Numbering Plan Indicator (NPI). Encoded as specified in section 5.2.6 The remaining octets contain the Call Back Number digits encoded as ASCII characters

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.37
tlvref.name: callback_num_pres_ind
tlvref.field: callback_num_pres_ind
Length of Value part in octets

Bits 7............0 0000ppss This parameter controls the presentation indication and screening of the CallBackNumber at the mobile station.If present, the callback_num parameter must also be present. The Presentation Indicator is encoded in bits 2 and 3 as follows: = Presentation All owed = Presentation Restricted = Number Not Available = Reserved The Screening Indicator is encoded in bits 0 and 1 as follows: = User provided, not screened = User provided, verified and passed10 = User provided, verified and failed 11 = Network Provided.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.38
tlvref.name: callback_num_atag
tlvref.field: callback_num_atag
Length of Value part in octets

Alphanumeric display tag for call back number Bits 7...............0 EEEEEEEE (octet 1) XXXXXXXX (octet 2) : : XXXXXXXX (octet N) The first octet contains the encoding scheme of the Alpha Tag display characters. This field contains the same values as for Data Coding Scheme (see section 5.2.19). The following octets contain the display characters: There is one octet per display character for 7-bit and 8-bit encoding schemes. There are two octets per display character for 16-bit encoding schemes.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.39
tlvref.name: number_of_messages
tlvref.field: number_of_messages
Length of Value part in octets
0 to 99 = allowed values. values 100 to 255 are reserved

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.41
tlvref.name: alert_on_message_delivery
tlvref.field: alert_on_message_delivery
Length of Value part in octets (= 0)
There is no Value part associated with this parameter.

tlvref.label: Table 5.3.2.43
tlvref.name: i
tlvref.field: its_session_info
Length of Value part in octets

Bits 7...............0 SSSS SSSS (octet 1) NNNN NNNE (octet 2) Octet 1 contains the session number (0 255) encoded in binary. The session number remains constant for each session. The sequence number of the dialogue unit (as assigned by the ESME) within the session is encoded in bits 7..1 of octet 2. The End of Sessio n Indicator indicates the message is the end of the conversation session and is encoded in bit 0 of octet 2 as follows: = End of Session Indicator inactive. = End of Session Indicator active.

format.label: Table B-1:
format.name: Delivery
format.desc: The fields of the above delivery receipt example are explained in the following table:
